title: New: James Blake: Not Long Enough
body: Let’s face it; the collaboration between **[Bon Iver](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/10334-video-bon-iver-holocene-watch/ "Video: Bon Iver – Holocene")** and **[James Blake](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/4358-review-james-blake-james-blake/ "Review: James Blake – James Blake")** was [awful.](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/10594-new-james-blake-bon-iver-fall-creek-boys-choir/ "New: James Blake & Bon Iver – Fall Creek Boys Choir")  CITR’s Nick Law summed it up in a tweet, “who knew that Blake and Iver could cancel each other out so spectacularly”, a harsh but justified way of looking at it. There’s still a lot to look forward to when it comes to the world of **Blake** however. His new EP, **_Enough Thunder_**, is out next month on **Atlas** and this new cut is a promising representation of what’s to come. It’s a slow, drawn out and somber piece of music. It’s a piece of music that calls out for recognition and support, with **Blake**’s vocals sounding more and more like **Jeff Buckley** as times moves along. Stream the BBC rip below and check back to CITR next month for a review of the EP.

excerpt.full: Let’s face it; the collaboration between Bon Iver and James Blake was awful.  CITR’s Nick Law summed it up in a tweet, “who knew that Blake and Iver could cancel each other out so spectacularly”, a harsh but justified way of looking at it. There’s still a lot to look forward to when it comes \[…\]
excerpt.short: Let’s face it; the collaboration between Bon Iver and James Blake was awful.
